intro: Hufelandia, commonly known as the "herb of health," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It typically features compound leaves with a fern-like appearance and small, yellowish or white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant is native to various regions in Europe and Asia and thrives in moist, temperate climates. Hufelandia species are often found in woodland areas and along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable plant for both ornamental and medicinal purposes.
